description.narrative: Compared to the West and North Africa regions, the East and Central Africa region remains underexplored for hydrocarbons and, despite recent major discoveries in Mozambique and Uganda, the region''s hydrocarbon potential remains largely untapped. The work and success of Delonex will help further promote the development of the hydrocarbon sector and encourage further investments in the region. Smaller companies, such as Delonex, tend to outperform the major oil companies on exploration success and new value creation. It is expected that independents will continue to lead the way in opening new basins, as governments open up more acreage onshore. Analysis shows that it is the companies that are well capitalized, with the right management team, and the correct understanding of the political and social landscape that are best placed to make transformational discoveries. By opening up new hydrocarbon discoveries in the region, Delonex will pave the way for the entry and broad participation of the large oil companies that bring with them the expertise and resources necessary to develop such new plays, thereby triggering economic activity for the region. This will eventually bring about substantial revenues to host governments through royalties and profit taxes generated from oil production, direct and indirect local employment and skills development in the host economy.

For the past decade, Sub Sahara Africa has been the focus of global exploration activity as it offers huge yet-to-be-found resources and it is believed some of the most prospective frontier basins in the world are in this continent, as exemplified by the recent large discoveries in Mozambique, Uganda and Tanzania. Delonex Energy Limited (Delonex or the Company) seeks to build a portfolio of East and Central African assets with proven, undeveloped reserves and contingent and prospective resources which it will bring to the development stage. The Company will target exploration-led opportunities in known petroleum systems, focusing mainly on two to three onshore/shallow water basins with common attributes and scalable to a material size. The portfolio will be built up through acquisitions, farm-ins and direct awards from host governments. The management team of Delonex is well advanced into pre-screening their first investments. Material equity stakes and operatorship will be targeted and partnerships will be built to access markets and mitigate risks. The Project will also seek to set a team on the ground, based in Kenya, in order to establish local presence, identify contractors, local content partners and create relationships with all stakeholders.
